metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23959 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Varnish Cache before 6.6.2 and 7.x before 7.0.2, Varnish Cache 6.0 LTSbefore 6.0.10, and and Varnish Enterprise (Cache Plus) 4.1.x before4.1.11r6 and 6.0.x before 6.0.9r4, request smuggling can occur for HTTP/1connections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvarnishapi2 - 6.2.1-2ubuntu0.1
varnish - 6.2.1-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: varnish package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.1-2ubuntu0.1').
